messages.title: STANDING WITH THERESA MAY
messages.content: It has been a real privilege to represent my home area in Parliament. My record shows that I have worked hard for the community and have always kept my promises to you. I have defended our excellent schools and fought to protect our access to world-class healthcare services at Wythenshawe Hospital. Working with local community groups and through questions and debates in Parliament I campaigned to stop the closure of Altrincham Hospital and to secure the new hospital with its clinics, minor injury unit and dialysis service. I hope you will renew your trust in me so that I can continue to work on your behalf.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Commits to making Brexit a success and negotiating with a strong hand to ensure the best deal for Britain, aims to achieve the strongest country with the best economic growth and national security.
Promises to build a stronger economy that rewards work and creates secure and well-paid jobs.
Has championed local schools to fight for their fair funding.
Defended access to world-class healthcare services and campaigned to stop the closure of Altrincham Hospital and to secure a new hospital with clinics, minor injury unit and dialysis service.

issues.brexitEurope: Ensuring that Brexit is a success and delivers a stronger economy with the ability to control our own laws.
issues.economy: Building a stronger economy that rewards people who work hard, with more secure and well-paid jobs.
issues.health: Protecting access to world-class healthcare services.

politicalExperience.achievements: Defended local schools, campaigned to stop the closure of Altrincham Hospital, and worked on securing a new hospital.

endorsements.endorsement: One of the most highly regarded backbench MPs.
Has a reputation for speaking out in an even-handed manner.
One of the more interesting beings.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet emphasizes the candidate's alignment with Prime Minister Theresa May and presents a 'strong and stable leadership' message, hinting at Conservative Party slogans during the election period.
